featured.text: When it is dark, they flash their lights on and off to signal to others of their species, to lure prey toward them, or to escape from predators.
Many of his works—depictions of children at play and in school, farm girls attending to their work, hunters and their prey—have become classic images of nineteenth-century American life.

definition.zh_def: 獵物；被捕食的動物或人
definition.en_def: An animal that is hunted and eaten by another animal.
definition.example: The lion stalked its prey in the tall grass.
